oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from Henion Patterson to Governor Hill McAlister
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Two-page penciled letter (front and back) related to writer's discharge from the Civilian Conservation Corps (CCC). Patterson wants to rejoin the CCC and explains that he had been working on a Jack Hammer when I was Discharged _____ that Dust got Down my throuth [throat] and thay Discharged on that a count. I am a Demercratt....

Henion Patterson was an African American from Anderson County at the time he wrote this letter. The CCC was established in 1933 as a means of providing jobs for unemployed young men from relief families. The enlistees planted trees; built bridges, parks, and roads; cultivated forests; constructed fire towers; and drained swamps. Draining swamps went a long way in preventing malaria. The Tree Army employed around 200,000 black men during the Depression.
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Patterson, Henion
